meanings.definition: To treat with contempt or disdain
meanings.sent1: She outscorns anyone who disagrees with her opinions.
meanings.sent2: He outscorns his classmates when they make mistakes.
meanings.sent3: The cat outscorns the dog when it comes to napping in the sun.
meanings.sent4: The queen's elegant demeanor outscorns all others in the court.
meanings.sent5: The teacher outscorns latecomers with a disapproving look.

meanings.definition: To surpass in scorn or derision
meanings.sent1: The bully outscorns his peers with hurtful comments.
meanings.sent2: She outscorns her rivals by belittling their achievements.
meanings.sent3: The comedian outscorns the audience with witty jokes.
meanings.sent4: His sarcasm outscorns all other forms of humor.
meanings.sent5: The critic outscorns mediocre performances with scathing reviews.
